Remember that Senate GOP leader McConnell called the local gov't aid and SALT deduction "blue state bailouts," even though his state of Kentucky gets almost 3 TIMES as many federal dollars back for every dollar it pays in taxes as New Jersey. https://rockinst.org/issue-areas/fiscal-analysis/balance-of-payments-portal/

Here is where it gets political: every GOP member of Congress opposed the local gov't & school relief that kept our property taxes down. GOP Senators all oppose restoring our SALT deduction, & are blocking our bills to require corporations to pay even the smallest minimum tax.

Last year, the House passed a 15% minimum tax on corporations' global profits, to prevent them from using foreign tax shelters and other dodges to evade taxes. We also voted to fund the IRS so it can go after wealthy tax cheats -- and give the rest of us decent customer service.

It's outrageous that huge corporations like Amazon, FedEx, and Nike get away with paying zero income tax. I have no problem with them making huge profits (or with the billionaires who run them). I just think they should pay taxes like the rest of us. https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/02/business/economy/zero-corporate-tax.html

I also helped lead an effort that passed the House to restore our SALT deductions, which would help every homeowner in NJ. Service is at the heart of Father Matt‚Äôs faith. It informs his work and passions.

From his experiences, he firmly believes that service is what brings neighbors closer together and can truly change the lives of people who need it most. #ServiceSpotlight

The community's response was astounding. Father Matt shared that he truly believes people want to help others and do good, sometimes they just don't know how. 

He now sees it as his duty to give his neighbors these opportunities. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FQphUT8WYAAKdEO.jpg

He began collecting supplies and partnered with other churches, community organizations, neighbors, and nonprofits to change the lives of these families who were suddenly and traumatically in very unfamiliar surroundings.
Last summer, when our Afghan allies arrived at the Joint Base as refugees, Father Matt knew he could bring together the Bordentown community to help.

Before COVID-19, Father Matt, Christ Church, & volunteers from Bordentown came together each month to cook meals for troops living in the Joint Base dorms. 

When COVID made this no longer possible, Father Matt knew that their work could not stop, it would just have to change.

With every family helped, Father Matt‚Äôs passion, understanding, and love for our community grows. 

In partnership with his parish, Father Matt‚Äôs efforts quickly expanded and took him to @jointbasemdl.

A volunteer firefighter, Father Matt also works with thousands of NJ families experiencing homelessness, delivering homemade meals, organizing free laundry nights, and during COVID-19, teaching them how to stay safe from the virus. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FQpg2w2WQAEQhVA.jpg
